articles.description: Asian shares slipped on Monday ahead of a week thronging with central bank meetings and U.S. inflation data, while the euro eked out a gain on relief the far right did not win the first round of the French presidential elections. French leader Emmanuel Macron…
articles.content:
* Asian stock markets : tmsnrt.rs/2zpUAr4
* Nikkei slips 0.6%, U.S. stock futures dip
* Caution reigns before U.S. CPI, ECB meeting
* Euro up a fraction after Macron wins first round
SYDNEY, Apri… [+3413 chars]
